trends: There have been 12 other sightings in Quakertown
There were no other sightings in Quakertown on or around July 6th 2009
Summary: 2 sightings within 10 minutes - satellite like but with extremely bright pulses.
divs: sighting detailsi was outside grilling and watching the stars at about 2:30am on july 6th (night of july 5th). the first object i noticed as a dim object, which i initially took to be a satellite, moving from west to southwest approximately 10 degrees above the treeline (about 50 degrees up from my position from the ground). it was dim but visible until it got brighter over about 3-4 seconds and then dimmed again over another 3-4 seconds. at its brightest, it was easily as bright as a plane's landing light coming straight at you (maybe 2-3 times as bright as a planet viewed with the naked eye). i was able to follow the object with my binoculars for about a minute after it dimmed before i lost sight of it completely. the second object i noticed during its first bright point. it was very similar to the first, but travelled from the southwest to the northwest and was directly overhead. it brightened and then dimmed twice while i observed it, both times brightening then dimming during the course of about 3-4 seconds. this object i viewed only with the naked eye, but it started out very bright, then dimmed to satellite\dim star level, then disappeared completely, then it reappeared dimly, brightened, then dimmed again and disappeared from sight completely. both sightings lasted about 30 seconds to a minute and were within 10 minutes of each other. both objects followed straight flight paths very similar to what a satellite would travel. i'm wondering if its possible for a satellite to reflect moonlight (it was very clear and the moon was nearly full) to produce the bright pulses i was seeing.
